title: Weeknight Mediterranean Chickpea Bowl
description: A protein-rich bowl with citrus tahini dressing and crunchy vegetables. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, paprika, and warm water into a silky dressing.
Toss chickpeas with dressing until coated.
Layer vegetables in bowls, top with dressed chickpeas, olives, and parsley.
Serve with warm pita on the side.

title: Weeknight Ginger Miso Soba
description: Brothy soba noodles layered with miso, ginger, and blistered greens. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Simmer broth with miso, ginger, and garlic until fragrant.
Blister mushrooms and bok choy in sesame oil.
Cook soba noodles separately until al dente.
Combine noodles with broth and vegetables; finish with scallions and sesame.

title: Weeknight Harissa Lamb Meatballs
description: Tender lamb meatballs glazed with harissa and honey. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Combine lamb, breadcrumbs, egg, garlic, cumin, and harissa; shape into meatballs.
Sear meatballs in olive oil until browned.
Glaze with honey and extra harissa; simmer until cooked through.
Serve with yogurt and mint.

title: Weeknight Chimichurri Flank Steak
description: Grilled flank steak with herbaceous chimichurri sauce. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Blend parsley, cilantro, garlic, oil, vinegar, oregano, and chili into chimichurri.
Marinate steak with half the sauce for 20 minutes.
Grill steak over high heat to medium-rare.
Rest, slice against the grain, and serve with remaining chimichurri.

title: Weeknight Coconut Red Curry
description: Creamy coconut curry with vegetables and fragrant basil. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Bloom curry paste in a splash of coconut cream until aromatic.
Add remaining coconut milk and stock; bring to a simmer.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Finish with fish sauce, sugar, and fresh basil; serve over rice.

title: Weeknight Smoked Salmon Frittata
description: Elegant baked frittata with smoked salmon and herbs. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Whisk eggs with milk, ricotta, dill, scallions, and lemon zest.
Fold in smoked salmon and capers.
Pour into oiled skillet and bake until set.
Rest briefly, slice, and serve warm or room temperature.

title: Weeknight Roasted Cauliflower Tacos
description: Crispy cauliflower tacos with lime crema and pickled onions. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Roast cauliflower tossed with oil and spices until crisp.
Warm tortillas and spread with crema.
Top with cauliflower, cabbage, and pickled onions.
Finish with cilantro and lime juice.

title: Weeknight Butter Chicken
description: Creamy tomato butter chicken with warm spices. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, ginger, and garlic.
Sear chicken until golden and set aside.
Simmer onions and tomatoes with spices; blend until smooth.
Return chicken, finish with cream and butter; garnish with cilantro.

title: Weeknight Lemon Herb Roast Salmon
description: Sheet-pan salmon with lemon, herbs, and seasonal vegetables. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Toss vegetables with oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder on a sheet pan.
Nestle salmon on top; drizzle with oil and scatter herbs and lemon.
Roast until salmon flakes easily.
Serve with roasted vegetables and pan juices.

title: Weeknight Smoky Black Bean Chili
description: Slow-simmered black bean chili with chipotle heat. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
ingredients: Fresh lime and cilantro to serve
steps: Sweat onions and peppers until soft.
Stir in garlic, chipotle, paprika, and tomato paste.
Add beans and broth; simmer until thickened.
Finish with lime juice and cilantro.

title: Weeknight Caprese Farro Salad
description: Hearty farro salad with tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella pearls. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Cook farro until tender; drain and cool.
Toss farro with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
Whisk oil, vinegar, and seasoning; drizzle over salad.
Finish with balsamic glaze and red pepper flakes.

title: Weeknight Sweet Potato Bibimbap
description: Colorful bibimbap with roasted sweet potatoes and gochujang sauce. A streamlined weeknight-friendly version that keeps the soul of the dish intact.
steps: Roast sweet potatoes until caramelized.
Saut spinach and bean sprouts separately with sesame oil.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble bowls with rice, vegetables, kimchi, sweet potatoes, and eggs; drizzle with gochujang sauce.
